prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: Young girl purporting to be the 2nd Yatagarasu. She's on the trail of her father's killer.
Character 1
Name: Byrne Faraday
Description: Father of Kay, and admirable prosecutor, he was killed 7 years ago by Calisto Yew
Character 2
Name: Calisto Yew
Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Shih-na
Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.
Character 13
Name: Ex-Security Lady
Description: The woman behind the Pink Princess mask. I believe her real name is Wendy Oldbag.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: As I said earlier, I was assigned to guard duty in the Allebahstian Embassy.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 1
Testimony: After I saw the Steel Samurai off on his way towards the ambassador's office...
Person: Franziska
Testimony 2
Testimony: ...I returned to the rose garden for a bit, and checked up on the security situation.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 3
Testimony: After all the preparations were in place, I was called back by Ambassador Alba to his office.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 4
Testimony: When I arrived, Ambassador Alba was watering the flowers on the windowsill.
Person: Franziska
Testimony 5
Testimony: There were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box.
Person: Franziska

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let me start by understanding the problem. I have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. My task is to find one pair where the evidence and testimony contradict each other.

First, I'll go through the testimonies to see what each one is saying. Then, I'll look at the evidences to find any conflicting information.

Looking at the testimonies, Testimony 5 says there were four large passionflowers in full bloom in the flower box. Now, checking the evidences, Evidence 14 mentions two large flowers in bloom. That's a direct contradiction because the testimony says four, while the evidence says two.

Wait, but I should make sure that the evidence is referring to the same location as the testimony. Evidence 14 talks about passionflowers in bloom, supported by stakes, and Ambassador Alba takes care of them. Testimony 5 is from Franziska, who was guarding the Allebahstian Embassy, so the flower box she's referring to is likely the same one mentioned in Evidence 14.

So, Testimony 5 claims four passionflowers, but Evidence 14 only mentions two. That's a clear contradiction. I think this is the pair I'm looking for.
</think>

Person: Lang

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem. I need to find a pair consisting of one evidence and one testimony that contradict each other. I'll start by reviewing the provided characters, evidences, and testimonies to understand the context better.

First, I'll look through the evidence list to identify any items that could potentially conflict with testimonies. Evidence 36 stands out to me. It's about security footage showing someone in a Steel Samurai costume pushing a pushcart into Babahl with a bulge in it. This seems significant because it directly ties the Steel Samurai to the scene, possibly indicating involvement in the crime.

Next, I'll examine the testimonies to find any that might contradict this evidence. Testimony 4 says, "You're a realist, after all, aren't you?" from Lang. This seems a bit vague, but considering Lang's character as someone with a high arrest rate and after a smuggling ring, his testimony might be downplaying the role of the Steel Samurai or suggesting a more realistic explanation without involving the costume.

Looking deeper, if the security footage (Evidence 36) shows the Steel Samurai pushing a pushcart, but Lang's testimony (Testimony 4) is trying to steer the focus away from such elements, there's a contradiction. The evidence suggests the Steel Samurai was involved, while the testimony might be dismissing that angle, indicating a conflict between the two.

I'll double-check to ensure there's no other pair that contradicts more directly, but this seems like the most straightforward contradiction. Therefore, Evidence 36 and Testimony 4 are the pair that contradict each other.
</think>

Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis. [info] Someone in the Steel Samurai costume is pushing a pushcart into Babahl. There is a bulge in the pushcart.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Frankly, I still don't understand why I am being placed under suspicion here.
Person: Alba
Testimony 1
Testimony: Under your hypothetical scenario, Mr. Coachen and I were fellow smugglers.
Person: Alba
Testimony 2
Testimony: In that case, what motive would I have had to kill my co-conspirator?
Person: Alba
Testimony 3
Testimony: But to get to the point, I was in Allebahst the whole time.
Person: Alba
Testimony 4
Testimony: So, it's simply not possible for me to have killed him in Babahl. That is my alibi.
Person: Alba

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. So, first, I need to understand the scenario. There are several characters involved, including ambassadors, detectives, and suspects, each with their own descriptions. Then there are evidences, which are physical items or documents related to the crimes, and testimonies, which are statements made by individuals involved.

The task is to find one pair where an evidence directly contradicts a testimony. That means I need to look for a situation where something someone said (testimony) is proven wrong or inconsistent by some physical evidence.

Let me start by skimming through the characters to get a sense of who's who. There's Kay Faraday, the protagonist, her father Byrne who was killed, Calisto Yew who killed him, and various other characters like detectives, ambassadors, and suspects like Manny Coachen, who is the victim in one of the cases.

Now, looking at the evidences, they range from a prosecutor's badge to more specific items like a knife with victim's blood, a counterfeit plate, and even a pushcart with blood inside. These are all physical items that could link someone to a crime.

The testimonies are statements made by individuals. For example, Ambassador Alba claims he was in Allebahst the whole time and couldn't have killed Coachen in Babahl. Franziska talks about her duties and movements around the embassy.

To find a contradiction, I need to find a testimony that makes a specific claim that is directly opposed by an evidence. For example, if someone says they were in one place at a certain time, but evidence shows they were elsewhere.

Looking at testimony 4: Ambassador Alba says he was in Allebahst the whole time and couldn't have killed Coachen in Babahl. Now, evidence 36 is security footage showing someone in a Steel Samurai costume pushing a pushcart into Babahl, and evidence 37 describes the pushcart having an unnatural bulge and blood inside. If Ambassador Alba was in Allebahst, but the pushcart was moved into Babahl, this could imply his involvement if the pushcart is linked to the crime.

Wait, but I'm not sure if Alba is the one in the Steel Samurai costume. Maybe the pushcart being in Babahl contradicts his alibi of being in Allebahst. Or perhaps the presence of blood in the pushcart suggests he was involved in the murder, which would contradict his testimony of not being able to kill Coachen in Babahl.

Alternatively, looking at testimony 0 where Alba says he doesn't understand why he's under suspicion, and evidence 33 is a counterfeit plate found in the fake Primidux Statue he smuggled. This could contradict his claim of innocence, as the counterfeit plate ties him to the smuggling ring.

But the most direct contradiction seems to be between testimony 4 (Alba's alibi) and evidence 36 and 37 (pushcart in Babahl with blood). If Alba claims to have been in Allebahst, but evidence shows a pushcart possibly used in the crime was moved into Babahl, it could suggest he was not where he claimed to be.

However, I need to pick one pair. Let's go with evidence 36 and testimony 4.
</think>

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by understanding the scenario. We have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder investigation involving Ambassador Alba and Manny Coachen. My task is to identify one pair where the evidence and testimony directly contradict each other.

First, I'll look at the testimonies provided by Ambassador Alba. There are four testimonies:

1. **Testimony 0**: Alba claims he killed Mr. Coachen in the theater using a knife stuck in his bouquet.
2. **Testimony 1**: He says he left the bouquet in the theater, implying that anyone could have taken the knife from there.
3. **Testimony 2**: He mentions that Mr. Coachen's body was found in Babahl.
4. **Testimony 3**: He argues that it's impossible for him to have transported the body from the theater to Babahl.

Now, I'll examine the evidence to find any contradictions. The key evidence here is **Evidence 35: Commemorative Photo**, which shows the murder weapon in Mr. Alba's bouquet. This directly supports Alba's claim in Testimony 0 that he used the knife from his bouquet to kill Coachen.

However, **Testimony 3** states that Alba couldn't have moved the body from the theater to Babahl. But according to **Evidence 36: Security Footage**, someone in a Steel Samurai costume was seen pushing a pushcart into Babahl, and there's a bulge in the pushcart. Additionally, **Evidence 37: Pushcart** mentions that there's blood inside the pushcart, which suggests that the body was indeed transported, possibly by Alba.

This creates a contradiction because Alba claims he couldn't have moved the body, but the security footage and the condition of the pushcart indicate that the body was transported from the theater to Babahl, which could implicate Alba.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between **Testimony 3** (Alba's claim of not being able to transport the body) and **Evidence 36 and 37** (showing the body was transported via the pushcart). However, since I need to choose one pair, I'll focus on **Testimony 3** and **Evidence 36**.
</think>

cot:
Alright, I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by reviewing the information provided.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Ambassador Quercus Alba from Allebahst and Manny Coachen, who was the victim. The testimonies provided are from Ambassador Alba, and the evidence includes things like the Security Footage, Pushcart, and Samurai Spear.

Looking at the testimonies, Ambassador Alba claims he was in the audience watching the show and remembers specific details, including a scene with the "Early Summer Rain Jab" move. He says this to establish his alibi, suggesting he couldn't have been involved in the murder because he was watching the performance.

Now, checking the evidence, specifically Evidence 15: Samurai Spear. It mentions that Larry Butz, the man behind the Steel Samurai mask, bent the spear against a wall, making it hollow and unusable for the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack. This indicates that the "Early Summer Rain Jab" move couldn't have been performed during the show because the spear was damaged.

Ambassador Alba's testimony claims he saw the "Early Summer Rain Jab" move, which contradicts the evidence that the spear was bent and the move couldn't have been executed. Therefore, his testimony about witnessing that specific move is false, which undermines his alibi.

So, the contradiction lies between Ambassador Alba's testimony about seeing the "Early Summer Rain Jab" and the evidence that the spear was bent, making that move impossible.
</think>
